results.title: Money in the bank
results.creator_credit: Cyril Randall Productions, Film Producers Guild and Geoffrey Nethercott
results.brief_description: The theories and workings of banking from sub-branches in small villages to great head offices, showing how banks can serve, help and advise everyone in their various pursuits.

results.title: Money for sale: the work of the Sydney Stock Exchange
results.brief_description: Activity at Sydney’s Stock Exchange and ways this activity can affect the man in the street. Includes an investment group meeting to discuss their plans, one of the classes held by the Stock Exchange to explain how the stock market works, and actual buying and selling on the floor of the Exchange. The cameras catch some of the tremendous activity which followed the announcement of the easing of credit restrictions.

results.title: Money = L'Argent
results.creator_credit: Marion's Films, Jean-Marc Henchoz and Robert Bresson
results.brief_description: Robert Bresson’s adaptation of Leo Tolstoy’s “The forged note” is a bleak tale of a minor transgression which spirals out of control, releasing an avalanche of broken lives and murder. Told in the director’s usual minimalist style, ‘L’Argent’ (Money) traces the path of destruction a forged bank note leaves when two upper class school boys try to pass it off onto an unsuspecting photography shop. The shop owner then knowingly hands it over to a delivery driver who is arrested for carrying the counterfeit money. As a consequence the delivery driver’s life descends into a series of tragic misfortunes which lead from petty theft to cold blooded murder, while the privileged school boys and shop keeper remain untarnished. In French with English subtitles. Cast includes Christian Patey, Vincent Risterucci, Caroline Lang, Sylvie Van Den Elsen, Marc-Ernest Fourneau, Andre Cler and Bruno Lapeyre. (Awards: 1983 Cannes Film Festival-Best Director Robert Bresson, 1984 National Society of Film Critics Awards USA- Best Director Robert Bresson)

results.title: Money-go-round
results.creator_credit: Liberatas Films, Margaret K Johns and Alvin Rakoff
results.brief_description: The work and responsibilities of stockbrokers and jobbers in the financial world are revealed to two teenagers, Peter and Susan, who are suddenly transported from the hurly burly of their local market to what they believe to be a “Champagne and Caviar” wonderland in the Stock Exchange. However they learn that the people involved are ordinary people, and that without a free Stock Exchange turning shares into money and money into shares at tremendous speed, the whole economy of the country would slow down. Featured also is the pop group The Koobas originating from Liverpool, England.

results.title: Monet in London
results.creator_credit: Arts Council of Great Britain, Balfour Films and David Thompson
results.brief_description: Presents the work of French painter Claude Monet during the period 1889 to 1901 when he lived in London. Shows the painter’s views of London, including Charing Cross Bridge, Waterloo Bridge, and St. Thomas’ Hospital, accompanied by readings from his diaries and letters.

results.title: Monet's garden at Giverny
results.creator_credit: Two Four Productions, Sadie Hennessy and Emma Ford
results.brief_description: The great impressionist Monet created his most inspirational subject on his own doorstep; Giverny is a garden that was planted to be painted. The production crew of this outstanding documentary were given unlimited access to Monet’s estate for a year, which allows the viewer to witness the full cycle of the seasons. Monet was a passionate horticulturalist who invested a lot of time in the garden at Giverny; this programme explores the enduring legacy of beauty that he left in the garden and in his art, and the incredible interrelationship between the two. Includes interviews with artists Kaffe Fassett and Paul Riley and photographer and Monet authority Vivian Russell.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Two Four Productions, Sadie Hennessy and Emma Ford

results.title: Mondo New York
results.creator_credit: International Harmony Productions, Stuart Shapiro and Harvey Keith
results.brief_description: A young woman wanders the clubs and streets of New York City in the mid 1980s in search of entertainment or just to seek out the freaks. She sees avant-garde style musicians, spoken word performances, junkies, sadomasochistic shows and comedians of the era. Not a narrative but more a compilation of performances, ‘Mondo New York’ is a glimpse of a moment in time, when the punk ethos of ‘shocking behaviour’ and being ‘alternative’ were celebrated in the arts/under world. Some scenes and language may offend and some animals ARE harmed in the making of this picture. Performers featured include: Lydia Lunch, Joey Arias, Rick Aviles, Charlie Barnett, Joe Coleman, Phoebe Legre and Ann Magnuson.

results.title: Mondo Lugosi: a vampire's scrapbook
results.brief_description: A compilation of movie trailers and excerpts from many of Bela Lugosi’s horror films dating from the 1930s to the late 1940s. Born Bela Ferenc Dezso Blasko on 20 October 1882 in Lugos, Hungary, Lugosi began his acting career on stage performing with the Budapest Academy of Theatrical Arts and as a leading actor with Hungary’s Royal National Theatre. By 1920 Lugosi had moved across to Germany where he began appearing in films. He emigrated to America in 1921 playing bit parts in obscure films until finally in 1931 he broke into the Hollywood scene, cast in the title role of the horror film, “Dracula”. Numerous other films of similar genre followed, including “Murders in the Rue Morgue” (1932), “The Invisible ray” (1936), “The Wolf man” (1941), “The Ghost of Frankenstein” (1942), “Frankenstein meets the Wolf Man” (1942) and “The Body snatcher” (1945). Trailers of these films, along with interviews and appearances by Lugosi on American television programs “Tribute to a star” and “You asked for it” are contained in this video. Includes scenes with Boris Karloff, Frances Drake, Claude Rains, Betty Boop and many other stars of the time.

results.title: Monarch butterfly story
results.brief_description: Portrays the four stages in the life cycle of the Monarch butterfly. Close-up photography depicts the Monarch laying its eggs, and shows the caterpillar eating its way out of the egg, feeding, moulting, forming its chrysalis, and emerging as a butterfly.
